key_points: The US Capitol complex in Washington, DC, was temporarily locked down during a rehearsal for President-elect Joe Biden's inauguration.
A fire in a homeless encampment about 1.6 kilometres away from the Capitol raised security concerns.
Officials stated there was no threat to the public or the inauguration from the fire.
The evacuation and lockdown were precautions taken by the acting chief of Capitol Police.
President-elect Joe Biden was not present at the rehearsal during the lockdown.
The lockdown follows heightened security measures due to the January 6 riot at the US Capitol.
Security in and around the Capitol has been increased, with the area being on high alert and lockdown.
Participants of the rehearsal, including a military band, were directed to move to a secure location inside the Capitol complex.
The US Secret Service announced on Twitter that the lockdown was a precautionary measure, confirming there was no public threat.
The fire department extinguished the fire near the Capitol, confirming there were no injuries and explaining the source of the smoke seen.
